result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven R. Scholze

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears with counsel James Ritland.  ADA Inlow appears for the State.  Inlow states the defendant will plead today.  Judge reviewed the charges/penalties of charges he will plead to today.  DA has complied with victim notification as required by law.  Court notifies defendant of felony conviction warning.  Defendant pleads no contest to all the following cases/charges:  14CF48 - Count 1; 14CF228 - Counts 1 & 3; 14CF88 -  Count 1.  Judge reviews elements of charges he's pleading to today.  Defense stipulates to facts in the complaint and agrees there is a factual basis for his pleas.  State recommends 3 years probation with conditions as stated in agreement:  restitution; no contact with L.S. or B.F.; maintain employment, must undergo a risk and needs assessment and must comply with any conditions recommended which may include anger mangagmen;  no drugs or paraphernalia; AODA assessment and must follow all recommendations;  no alcohol consumption or be where available.  Defense doesn't agree with restitution in 14CF228 and requests a restitution hearing.  State will schedule the restitution hearing.   Court reviews PLQ and elements of each charge plead to and makes a finding that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his rights, makes his pleas, a factual basis exists for each plea.  Court accepts the pleas and finds him guilty of charges plead to.  Defense agrees to terms of probation but requests a 2 1/2 years probation term rather than 3 years.  Defendant does not speak on his behalf.  Court orders 3 years probation concurrent with probation now serving but after 30 months he may apply for early discharge if no new charges/convictions.  All conditions ordered as recited by ADA Inlow.  Inlow is unsure what he has for jail credit.  She will get an accurate accounting of jail credit from the jail.  Court instructs counsel to prepare a stipulation if they agree and send with a proposed order to amend the JOC.  Costs assessed and no DNA surcharges assessed.  Must submit a DNA sample - he already has one on file.  15CF22 - DRI;  14CF162 - DRI; 14CF228 - Counts 2, 4, 5 ,6 are DRI; 14CF48 - Count 2 - DRI; 14FO546 - DRI.  Restitution order to be submitted within 60 days.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Ritland appeared.  Defendant is not ready to plead today.  Reschedule to 12/22/15 at 1:15 pm.  Deadline to plead or settle.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared with counsel James Ritland.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Rtiland states his client will waive his right to the preliminary hearing.  Court reviews the waiver form and the right to a preliminary hearing with defendant.  Court finds he freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his right to a preliminary hearing; bound over for trial.  Attorney Ritland notifies the Court he will file a request for substitution but wishes to proceed to arraignment.  Court makes a finding that the request was made timely but he should still file the document for such today.  Court reviews charges in Information with defense; wavied reading and stood mute.  Court enters not guilty plea.  Counsel states they have already pre-trialed this case so it should be scheduled with the new Judge that gets assigned.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:Brenda F. & Mary D. Report for booking
Court questions defendant on waiver.  Finds defendant has waived the time limits for preliminary hearing.  PTC & STC set.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing
